section: A. Recipient wishes to engage the Vendor to provide certain services and resources (the "Deliverables") and Provider desires to provide Recipient with the Services all in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth herein.
explanation: The Recitals section states that Recipient wishes to engage the 'Vendor,' but the rest of the agreement refers to the service provider as the 'Provider.' This misalignment creates confusion as to which entity is actually providing the services.

section: 3.1 Termination of Agreement. This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement and shall terminate on December 31, 2020, unless terminated earlier in accordance with Section 3.2.
explanation: The sentence structure in Section 3.1 is flawed and unclear. It awkwardly repeats 'Agreement' and lacks proper grammar, making it difficult to understand the intended duration of the agreement.

section: Provider Representatives shall be dedicated to solely providing the Services to Recipient and shall not provide any such services or resources to Provider or any other customer of Provider.
explanation: This section states that Provider Representatives should only provide services to the Recipient, but Section 1.1(a) allows for additional services requested by the Recipient and agreed upon. It isn't clear how the Provider Representatives can provide additional services outside of Exhibit A when this section states that they will only be providing services to the Recipient and not the Provider. This is an in-text contradiction.
